data.title: Historic Southern California Restaurants Tribute by Jeffrey Sward
data.text:
Notes

[1} Drugstore portion opened 1899.

{2} Home of the World's Best Hamburger

[3] Founded by the Fink family in 1958. Moved to current location in 1972. Closed after the death of the fourth owner, Billy Williams.

[4] The oldest operating McDonald's restaurant, the third to be opended.

[5] Third oldest Taco Bell still operating

[6] Founded in 1936 as Old Vienna Gardens Restaurant. Various ownership changes starting in 1970s. Major renovation in the 2020s.

[7] Since 2022 Bo's House of Omelette's

[a] Run by Otto and Angie Hasselbarth 1972-2015

[b] Run by three generations of the Zlaket family. Leo Zlaket Sr. was the first owner. Virginia and Leo Zlaket Jr. were the second generation, still operating the deli, age 70 and 71 at closure. The third generation, David Zlaket, age 43 at closure, could not support his family on the Deli income and his folks urged him to move on.

All written content of this web site is solely the editorial opinion of Jeffrey Sward.
